comment: Dr. Woodard has a straightforward approach to teaching and gives you the tools/study guides needed to succeed. With any class, you must put forth an effort to do well but if you utilize the study guides you will succeed. Highly recommend taking her class.

Professor Woodard is amazing and by far the best professor I have had!! She is so kind and responds promptly to emails. She genuinely cares about her students and is passionate about history. Her tests and quizzes cover everything learned and are straightforward. Plus, she makes boring lectures easy to understand and fun. 1000% recommend!

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!! She is amazing and makes class fun and interesting!!!! She also treats you like a person and makes sure to know everyones name and a little about them. Truly the best professor ever and the class itself is easy as long as you do the assignments.
I love Professor Woodard! If you put effort into the class, you will get an A. She gives plenty of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester and takes student feedback into consideration.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her over the summer and got an A. It's not hard, just do the work and follow rubric stricly and it's an A. (Webcam/lockdown)

Amazing class! All the assignments are super easy, and she gives you great feedback on everything. Quizzes are simple every unit with two attempts, discussion posts are straight forward and she gives you multiple chances to do every reflection. Her lectures are super interesting to listen to, and you can tell she really cares about every student.

Dr. Woodard is such an amazing professor! She cares about the class deeply, and provides very detailed feedback on assignments. She is truly so understanding and wants every single student to succeed! She is the best at what she does.

Take her. There is a bit of work to do each week, but nothing too hard as long as you manage your time right, to be honest, if you wanted to, you could do all the work in a day. It would take 1-2 hours max after you learned the material for the week. She's a great person and an even more outstanding teacher. Do not be afraid to ask for help.

Very adorable Professor. Really cares about students and makes the class always fun. A lot of things to do during the week but as long as you do not procrastinate it is manageable. Plenty of extra credits to make up for your grades during the semester.

Take this class if you can!! I took this class online. Yes there's of work in one week but they are simple. There are weekly quizzes, weekly reflections, and discussions. She drop half of the weekly reflections. They are easy if you take notes and understand them. Dr. Woodard gives great feedback and extra credits so do them because they are easy.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I am hard to please given my low attention span, but taje my word on it: Professor Woodard is AMAZING! I took an AP world history class in high school and learned absolutely nothing at all, but Professor Woodard's lectures have helped me SO much. There is a lot of material, so make sure to take notes, gives extra credit, easy class if you study!

If you need a World History credit or not, TAKE THIS CLASS, you'll have a lot of fun and learn a lot as well. There's a no electronics rule in her class; phones, laptops, etc. Doesn't round grades, but gives a lot of extra credit, take advantage. Simple grading scale, so it's easy to find your grade. Attendance is a grade as well as participation.
Weekly discussion assignments, 10-question weekly multiple-choice quizzes, 3 multiple-choice exams cover a LOT of ground but she provides detailed reviews.

I have to say that Professor Woodard is one of the best professors that I have ever had. Despite there being a ton of busy work, I have truly enjoyed this class. I have never met a teacher that was as engaged with their class as Dr. Woodard. She cares about the success of each individual student. I actually learned things.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This teacher is ridiculous with the amount of work she gives. 2 quiz, a weekly reflection about 2 written pages each week, weekly small group discussions and whole class discussions. Quizzes are on lockdown and If you do not do exactly what she wants she will give you a failing grade.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She truly is so passionate and wants to help every student succeed. There are weekly reflections and quizzes due on Sunday's (very easy). Participation is part of your grade. She gives LOTS of extra credit at the end. Her tests are EXACTLY from the notes. Very easy A if you put in a little effort.

I absolutely love history and her class made me love it more. There is a bit of work to get used too, but its the same work load every week. A lot of extra credit opportunities and her pp are great. She knows what shes talking about. Weekly reflections with the readings were the only things I didnt really like because it was time consuming.

Dr. Woodard is one of the best professors at KSU. She makes class interesting and finds ways to make you care. She offers plenty of extra credit, and as long as you study, you will make good grades. I am awful at history, and I always looked forward to this class. She cares about each individual student and wants to get to know you. Take her!

Professor Woodard is super sweet and understanding! This class has so many extra credit opportunities that it is hard to fail. You do have to earn your grade and tests can be difficult, but nothing too unusual. Her lectures are interesting and you do have weekly responses and readings, but they are not hard and boost your overall grade a lot!

Professor Woodard is such a great professor! She only requires a little bit of weekly work. Her tests are hard though and you cant use your phone or laptop during class. But I would still take her, shes a very helpful & caring professor.

She is amazing. Take good notes you will be fine. Tests come straight from the lecture. Her essay questions are straight-up easy if you pay attention. You have like 2 readings a week with a very short discussion post. Lots of extra credit that will even make up for attendance. I made a 100 in the class and i would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Woodard was new this year and did an outstanding job. She is very passionate about history and it shows. This is a lecture class so its majorly notes and lecture powerpoints. She gives an immense amount of extra credit as well. Her tests arent too hard as long as you put in some study time. I highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: As a History major I really enjoyed her class for the most part. She is a pretty good speaker and she did her best to include students in the conversation. Only thing I didn't really like was her no laptop/phone policy and her Mini-Essay instructions at the beginning or end of every class. Other than that, great teacher for Modern World History!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures
